articles.author: SCOTT McFETRIDGE
articles.description: DES MOINES, Iowa (AP) — As Cary Fowler and Geoffrey Hawtin began thinking about ways to prevent starvation and protect the world's food supply, they came up with what Fowler called “the craziest idea anybody ever had” — a global seed vault built into the side of an Arctic mountain.
articles.title: Men behind the doomsday seed vault in the Arctic win World Food Prize

articles.author: MICHAEL R. SISAK, JAKE OFFENHARTZ, JENNIFER PELTZ and COLLEEN LONG
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Donald Trump's defense attorney on Thursday accused Stormy Daniels of slowly altering the details of an alleged 2006 sexual encounter with Trump, trying to persuade jurors that a key prosecution witness in the former president's hush money trial cannot be believed.
articles.title: Stormy Daniels delivers shocking testimony about Trump, but trial hinges on business records

articles.author: ADRIANA GOMEZ LICON
articles.description: Former President Donald Trump is limited in what he can publicly say as he fights charges that he made payments to a porn actor to illegally influence the 2016 election.
articles.title: Trump is limited in what he can say about his court case. His GOP allies are showing up to help

articles.author: JOSEPH KRAUSS and JOSEF FEDERMAN
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Thursday that a U.S. threat to withhold some arms would not prevent Israel from continuing its offensive in Gaza, indicating it might proceed with an invasion of the packed city of Rafah against the wishes of its closest ally.
articles.title: Netanyahu on US threat to withhold arms: Israel will fight with its 'fingernails' if needed

articles.author: AAMER MADHANI, ZEKE MILLER and JULIA FRANKEL
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu have long managed a complicated relationship, but they're running out of space to maneuver as their views on the Gaza war diverge and their political futures hang in the balance.
articles.title: The Biden-Netanyahu relationship is strained like never before. Can the two leaders move forward?

articles.author: STEPHEN SMITH and MIKE SCHNEIDER
articles.description: FORT WALTON BEACH, Fla. (AP) — A Florida sheriff released body camera video Thursday showing a deputy outside an apartment door and firing immediately when it was opened by a Black man carrying a handgun pointed downward, a killing the family denounced as “unjustifiable.”
articles.title: Body camera video shows fatal shooting of Black airman by Florida deputy in apartment doorway

articles.author: RICK BOWMER and AMY BETH HANSON
articles.description: SANDY, Utah (AP) — Two backcountry skiers were killed and one was rescued after they were swept up and buried in an avalanche Thursday in the mountains outside of Salt Lake City that occurred after several days of spring snowstorms, authorities said.
articles.title: 2 skiers killed after being caught in Utah avalanche following late spring snowstorms, sheriff says

articles.author: FARNOUSH AMIRI
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Mike Johnson's job isn't safe yet. In a stunning show of unity in the often divided House, Democrats joined a majority of Republicans on Wednesday to save the GOP speaker from an attempt by fellow Republican Rep.
articles.title: House Speaker Mike Johnson survived a motion to vacate. Here's why his job is far from safe

articles.author: LYNN BERRY, DIDI TANG, JILL COLVIN and ELLEN KNICKMEYER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Making future military aid to Ukraine contingent on the country participating in peace talks with Russia.
articles.title: Trump-affiliated group releases new national security book outlining possible second-term approach

articles.author: WYATTE GRANTHAM-PHILIPS
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — A newly released ad promoting Apple's new iPad Pro has struck quite a nerve online.The ad, which was released by the tech giant Tuesday, shows a hydraulic press crushing just about every creative instrument artists and consumers have used over the years — from a piano and record player, to piles of paint, books, cameras and relics of arcade games.
articles.title: Technology crushing human creativity? Apple's new iPad ad has struck a nerve online
